intro: Cyanea eleeleensis, commonly known as the Haleakalā Cyanea, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments on rocky slopes or in forest understories. Cyanea eleeleensis is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of its endemic habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
